grid_data.help:
========================================= GRID naming convention ========================================= The notation for the grid longname is a%name_l%name_oi%name_r%name_m%mask_g%name_w%name where a% => atm, l% => lnd, oi% => ocn/ice, r% => river, m% => mask, g% => glc, w% => wav
Supported out of the box grid configurations are given via alias specification in the file "config_grids.xml". Each grid alias can also be associated with the following optional attributes
compset (Regular expression for compset matches that are required for this grid) not_compset (Regular expression for compset matches that are not permitted this grid)
Using the alias and the optional "compset" and "not_compset" attributes a grid longname is created Note that the mask is for information only - and is not an attribute of the grid By default, if the mask is not specified below, it will be set to the ocnice grid And if there is no ocnice grid (such as for single column, the mask is null since it does not mean anything)

domain.name: reg
domain.desc: regional grid mask:

domain.name: usgs
domain.desc: USGS mask

domain.name: null
domain.desc: null is no grid:

domain.name: gx1v6

domain.name: gx3v7
domain.desc: gx3v7 is displaced Greenland pole v7 3-deg grid:

domain.name: oEC60to30v3
domain.desc: oEC60to30v3 is a MPAS ocean grid generated with the eddy closure density function that is roughly comparable to the pop 1 degree resolution:

domain.name: oEC60to30v3wLI
domain.desc: oEC60to30v3wLI is a MPAS ocean grid generated with the eddy closure density function with 30 km gridcells at the equator, 60 km at mid-latitudes, and 35 km at high latitudes. It is roughly comparable to the POP 1 degree resolution. Additionally, it has ocean under landice cavities:

domain.name: ECwISC30to60E1r2
domain.desc: ECwISC30to60E1r2 is a MPAS ocean grid generated with the eddy closure density function with 30 km gridcells at the equator, 60 km at mid-latitudes, and 35 km at high latitudes. It is roughly comparable to the POP 1 degree resolution. Additionally, it has ocean under landice cavities. Revision2:

domain.name: oRRS30to10v3
domain.desc: oRRS30to10v3 is an MPAS ocean grid with a mesh density function that is roughly proportional to the Rossby radius of deformation, with 30 km gridcells at low and 10 km gridcells at high latitudes:

domain.name: oRRS30to10v3wLI
domain.desc: oRRS30to10v3wLI is an MPAS ocean grid with a mesh density function that is roughly proportional to the Rossby radius of deformation, with 30 km gridcells at low and 10 km gridcells at high latitudes: Additionally, it has ocean under landice cavities:

domain.name: oRRS18to6v3
domain.desc: oRRS18to6v3 is an MPAS ocean grid with a mesh density function that is roughly proportional to the Rossby radius of deformation, with 18 km gridcells at low and 6 km gridcells at high latitudes:

domain.name: ICOS10
domain.desc: ICOS10 is an MPAS ocean grid with an icosahedral mesh with about 7.5 km gridcells globally:

domain.name: oARRM60to10
domain.desc: oARRM60to10 is an Arctic-Region-Refined MPAS ocean grid with 30 km gridcells at -90 deg latitude, 60 km gridcells at -40 deg latitude, 30 km gridcells at the equator, and 10 km gridcells at 90 deg latitude; North Atlantic and North Pacific have different resolution between 0 and 60 deg latitudes:

domain.name: oARRM60to6
domain.desc: oARRM60to6 is an Arctic-Region-Refined MPAS ocean grid with 30 km gridcells at -90 deg latitude, 60 km gridcells at -40 deg latitude, 30 km gridcells at the equator, and 6 km gridcells at 90 deg latitude; North Atlantic and North Pacific have different resolution between 0 and 60 deg latitudes:

domain.name: ARRM10to60E2r1
domain.desc: ARRM10to60E2r1 is an Arctic-Region-Refined MPAS ocean grid with 30 km gridcells at -90 deg latitude, 60 km gridcells at -40 deg latitude, 30 km gridcells at the equator, and 10 km gridcells at 90 deg latitude; North Atlantic and North Pacific have different resolution between 0 and 60 deg latitudes:

domain.name: EC30to60E2r2
domain.desc: EC30to60E2r2 is a MPAS ocean grid generated with the jigsaw/compass process using the eddy closure density function that is roughly comparable to the pop 1 degree resolution:

domain.name: WC14to60E2r3
domain.desc: WC14to60E2r3 is a MPAS ice/ocean grid with enhanced resolution of 14km along the coast of North America, the Northern Atlantic subpolar gyre, and the Arctic Ocean. The high resolution regions smoothly transition to the background resolution of the standard low resolution 60to30km grid:

domain.name: WCAtl12to45E2r4
domain.desc: WCAtl12to45E2r4 is an MPAS ice/ocean grid with enhanced resolution of 45km over most of the equatorial Atlantic basin, 12km in the Northern Atlantic subpolar gyre, 12km in the Arctic Ocean, with coarsest resolution of 45km in the Pacific mid-latitudes. For the Southern Atlantic and Southern Ocean, resolution is 12km at high latitudes. High resolution transitions smoothly to the background resolution of the standard low resolution 60to30km grid:

domain.name: SOwISC12to60E2r4
domain.desc: SOwISC12to60E2r4 is a MPAS ice/ocean grid with enhanced resolution of 12km in the Southern Ocean around Antarctica. The high resolution regions smoothly transition to the background resolution of the standard low resolution 60to30km grid:

domain.name: FRISwISC08to60E3r1
domain.desc: FRISwISC08to60E3r1 is a MPAS ice/ocean grid with enhanced resolution of 12km in the Southern Ocean around Antarctica and 4 km beneath the Filchner-Ronne Ice Shelf. The high resolution regions smoothly transition to the background resolution of the standard low resolution 60to30km grid:

domain.name: FRISwISC04to60E3r1
domain.desc: FRISwISC04to60E3r1 is a MPAS ice/ocean grid with enhanced resolution of 12km in the Southern Ocean around Antarctica and 4 km beneath the Filchner-Ronne Ice Shelf. The high resolution regions smoothly transition to the background resolution of the standard low resolution 60to30km grid:

domain.name: FRISwISC02to60E3r1
domain.desc: FRISwISC02to60E3r1 is a MPAS ice/ocean grid with enhanced resolution of 12km in the Southern Ocean around Antarctica and 4 km beneath the Filchner-Ronne Ice Shelf. The high resolution regions smoothly transition to the background resolution of the standard low resolution 60to30km grid:

domain.name: FRISwISC01to60E3r1
domain.desc: FRISwISC01to60E3r1 is a MPAS ice/ocean grid with enhanced resolution of 12km in the Southern Ocean around Antarctica and 4 km beneath the Filchner-Ronne Ice Shelf. The high resolution regions smoothly transition to the background resolution of the standard low resolution 60to30km grid:

domain.name: ECwISC30to60E2r1
domain.desc: ECwISC30to60E2r1 is a MPAS ocean grid generated with the jigsaw/compass process using the eddy closure density function that has 30 km gridcells at the equator, 60 km at mid-latitudes, and 35 km at high latitudes. Additionally, it has ocean in ice-shelf cavities:

domain.name: IcoswISC30E3r5
domain.desc: IcoswISC30E3r5 is a MPAS ocean grid generated with the jigsaw/compass process using a dual mesh that is a subdivided icosahedron, resulting in a nearly uniform resolution of 30 km. Additionally, it has ocean in ice-shelf cavities:

domain.name: IcosXISC30E3r7
domain.desc: IcosXISC30E3r7 is a MPAS ocean grid generated with the jigsaw/compass process using a dual mesh that is a subdivided icosahedron, resulting in a nearly uniform resolution of 30 km.:

domain.name: RRSwISC6to18E3r5
domain.desc: RRSwISC6to18E3r5 is a MPAS ocean grid generated with the jigsaw/compass process using a mesh density function that is roughly proportional to the Rossby radius of deformation, with 18 km gridcells at low and 6 km gridcells at high latitudes. Additionally, it has ocean in ice-shelf cavities:

domain.name: SOwISC12to30E3r3
domain.desc: SOwISC12to30E3r3 is a MPAS ocean grid generated with the jigsaw/compass process using XXXXX. Additionally, it has ocean in ice-shelf cavities:

domain.name: r2
domain.desc: r2 is 2 degree river routing grid (only used for testing):

domain.name: rx1
domain.desc: rx1 is 1 degree river routing grid (only valid for DROF):

domain.name: r05
domain.desc: r05 is 1/2 degree river routing grid:

domain.name: r01
domain.desc: r01 is 1/10 degree river routing grid:

domain.name: r0125
domain.desc: r0125 is 1/8 degree river routing grid:

domain.name: r025
domain.desc: r025 is 1/4 degree river routing grid:

domain.name: mp120v1
domain.desc: mp120v1 is a MPAS ocean grid that is roughly 1 degree resolution:

domain.name: mp120r10v1
domain.desc: mp120r10v1 is a MPAS grid:

domain.name: mpas.aisgis20km
domain.desc: mpas.aisgis20km is a uniform-resolution 20km MALI grid of the Antarctic and Greenland Ice Sheets. It is primarily intended for testing.

domain.name: mpas.gis20km
domain.desc: mpas.gis20km is a uniform-resolution 20km MALI grid of the Greenland Ice Sheet. It is primarily intended for testing.

domain.name: mpas.gis1to10km
domain.desc: mpas.gis1to10km is a variable-resolution, from 1- to 10-km, MALI grid of the Greenland Ice Sheet.

domain.name: mpas.gis1to10kmR2
domain.desc: mpas.gis1to10kmR2 is an updated (fewer grid cells; improved optimization) variable-resolution, from 1- to 10-km, MALI grid of the Greenland Ice Sheet.

domain.name: mpas.ais20km
domain.desc: mpas.ais20km is a uniform-resolution 20km MALI grid of the Antarctic Ice Sheet. It is primarily intended for testing.

domain.name: mpas.ais8to30km
domain.desc: mpas.ais8to30km is a variable resolution MALI mesh of the Antarctic Ice Sheet with resolution varying from 8 km in fast flowing regions and near the ice-sheet margins to 30 km in the ice-sheet interior. It behaves reasonably well for most of the ice sheet but results in Thwaites Glacier retreating too rapidly due to insufficient resolution there. It is meant as a cheaper alternative to mpas.ais4to20km for testing realistic conditions.

domain.name: mpas.ais4to20km
domain.desc: mpas.ais4to20km is a variable resolution MALI mesh of the Antarctic Ice Sheet with resolution varying from 4 km in fast flowing regions and near the ice-sheet margins to 20 km in the ice-sheet interior. It was the primary mesh and initial condition used for ISMIP6-Antarctica-2300 and is the primary Antarctic mesh to use for E3SM v3 simulation and development with an active Antarctic Ice Sheet component.

domain.name: wQU225EC60to30
domain.desc: WW3 unstructured QU 225km global grid with EC60to30 coastlines

domain.name: wQU225EC30to60E2r2
domain.desc: WW3 unstructured QU 225km global grid with EC30to60E2r2 coastlines

domain.name: wQU225Icos30E3r5
domain.desc: WW3 unstructured QU 225km global grid with ICOS30 coastlines

domain.name: tx0.1v2
domain.desc: tx0.1v2 is an old mask used for CONUS:

domain.name: oQU480
domain.desc: oQU480 is an MPAS ocean mesh with quasi-uniform 480 km grid cells, nominally 4 degree resolution:

domain.name: oQU240
domain.desc: oQU240 is an MPAS ocean mesh with quasi-uniform 240 km grid cells, nominally 2 degree resolution:

domain.name: oQU240wLI
domain.desc: oQU240wLI is an MPAS ocean mesh with quasi-uniform 240 km grid cells, nominally 2 degree resolution. Additionally, it has ocean under landice cavities.:

domain.name: oQU120
domain.desc: oQU120 is an MPAS ocean mesh with quasi-uniform 120 km grid cells, nominally 1 degree resolution:

domain.name: oRRS15to5
domain.desc: oRRS15to5 is an MPAS ocean grid with a mesh density function that is roughly proportional to the Rossby radius of deformation, with 15 km gridcells at low and 5 km gridcells at high latitudes:
